title: Uttar Pradesh elections 2017: Mayawati mocks BJP, calls it Bharatiya 'Jumla' party | Uttar Pradesh Elections 2017 - Times of India

organizations.name: uttar pradesh elections 2017 - times of india mayawati
bhartiya janta party ko bhartiya jumla party

text: Mayawati mocks BJP, calls it Bharatiya 'Jumla' party Mayawati mocks BJP, calls it Bharatiya 'Jumla' party Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) supremo Mayawati on Wednesday while hitting back at Prime Minister Narendra Modi, said that "BJP is now also denoted as Bhartiya Jumla Party by many in the country." TNN | Updated: Feb 22, 2017, 04.46 PM IST Highlights "BJP is now referred as Bhartiya Jumla Party not only in Uttar Pradesh but also outside the state," Mayawati said. The BSP supremo's retort came a day after PM, at an election rally in Bundelkhand, noted that BSP is no longer Bahujan Samaj Party. She also claimed that if BJP comes to power after the state elections, all reservations will go away. Bahujan Samaj Party supremo Mayawati while addressing an election rally in Uttar Pradesh's Faizabad district (Photo: ANI) NEW DELHI: Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) supremo Mayawati on Wednesday while hitting back at Prime Minister Narendra Modi , said that " BJP is now also denoted as Bhartiya Jumla Party by many in the country." The BSP leader said, "BJP is now referred as Bhartiya Jumla Party not only in Uttar Pradesh but also outside the state." Ab log UP mein hi nahi balki purey desh mein Bhartiya Janta Party ko Bhartiya Jumla Party bhi kehne lage hain-BSP chief Mayawati in Faizabad pic.twitter.com/VKIqKgIkvV â€” ANI UP (@ANINewsUP) February 22, 2017 "Perturbed at the rising popularity of the BSP, PM (Modi) is indulging in petty talk about its supreme leader and has termed BSP as 'Behenji Sampatti Party' (Behenji Assets Party)," she said at an election rally in Uttar Pradesh's Faizabad district. Mayawati is popularly known as 'Behenji.' She also claimed that if BJP comes to power after the state elections, all reservations will go away. "You can't imagine how many cases like Rohith Vemula will take place in the state, if BJP comes to power in Uttar Pradesh," she said. The BSP supremo's retort came a day after Modi, at an election rally in Orai region of Jalaun in Bundelkhand region, noted that BSP is no longer Bahujan Samaj Party. "...bahujan toh Mayawati me simat gaya hai...it is Behenji Sampatti Party now. Those who deposit wealth for themselves, can they solve your problem?" Modi had asked.
